Sehr cooles und spannendes Spiel. Die Grafiken sind 1 a
Really fun and well thought out game. A few rough spots here and there on some map designs and servers sometimes cause issues but well worth the money.

I have every chapter of this game and as you can see, dropped over 580 hours into it. At its core it is a great game. However, the amount of camping and tunneling that has made it's way in recently is over bearing and completely kills all the fun this game was designed for. There are too many players that go out of their way to ruin the experience for you and do not play in the spirit of the game. I've made it to the top survivor rank, I know how to play the game very well but these players have destroyed what this game is meant to be. If you're lucky enough to get a game where everyone plays fairly then you'll love it but these games are so rare it's not worth it. Until the developers can stamp this out I cannot recommend this game. I think it's time to put it away and move on.
This has been a great game I was scared to play it at first but now I can't stop... I think I might have a problem, at least I'm happy!
Worst community, worst selection of players for match

Dead by Daylight has been out for 5 years and has far more problems than a game with that lifetime really warrants. Many of those problems have been in the game, unaddressed, for years. Despite all that, I still enjoy it sometimes, but would I recommend it to new people? No. Not in good conscience. All in all 2/5- meh.

I think that dead by daylight is a great game with a great concept and it has many fun things to do and lots of fun characters. However, its not perfect. There are still issues. There are lots of toxic players and as killer if you are up against a friend group of 4, it is unfair and often unfun. and also if you want to unlock new characters, you have to play for hours to get enough currency to unlock 1 character. but for liscened characters you have to pay. i understand why but the game overrall is very fun and enjoyable.
mi amigo lucho se cago xd. literal se mancho unos pantalones caros. se re enojo y se la agarro conmigo casi me mata, recomendado igual

Came back to this game after being at 125 hours, and currently at 200+ more hours in and i am fully invested again. 

However for as addictive DBD is, the game puts crazy mental pressure on you from the toxic side of the community. I mean just look at some of my profile comments in the past couple weeks... 
For as many people that will camp, tunnel, teabag and click their flashlight at supersonic speeds; there are positive people in this game and for those people, they make the game enjoyable.

But if you are a sadistic player like myself then sometimes finding these toxic players give you the best sense of relief after shitting on them for the entire match. It honestly is like the ultimate post nut clarity when you see the end game chat, and its flooded with angry messages from the salty people you have just passed your judgement on. No feeling can be better!

So be warned this game will suck the soul out of you, but once you get good enough, and watch so much Otz guides that you see him at your bedside when you are falling asleep. You will then see the light at the end of the tunnel, and begin to hit insane Z flicks with blight, and crossmap hatchet survivors behind rocks, and 1080 spin some console killer with the sensitivity of a child without thumbs. 

Then you are playing DBD at full capacity, until your idiotic brain wants you to prestige level 3 every character in existence, so be ready. But most of all have fun, its a wild ride!
Good replayability and ranking system. 100 hours in and climbing.

This game is pretty unforgiving when you first start out and don't know what you are doing. Playing with a 4 stack of friends really helps. When you learn how to play and get used to it, this game is very fun!
Very fun game, just don't take it too seriously
This game has a nice way to get you hooked
Hit boxes are dog shit and so is the game. Try it out tho.
